column1: Malignant teratoma is a type of cancer made of cysts that contain one or more of the three layers of cells found in a developing baby (embryo).
Malignant teratoma is one type of germ cell tumor.
Malignant teratoma occurs most often in young men in their 20s - 30s.

A number of other cancers are often associated with these tumors, including: - Acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) - Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma - Malignant histiocytosis - Myelodysplasia (MDS) - Small cell undifferentiated carcinoma
The health care provider will perform a physical exam, which may reveal a blockage of the veins entering the center of the chest due to increased pressure in the chest area.
